most_active_tickets.title: Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?

common_issues.title: Simultaneous Google and GitHub account linking issue
common_issues.description: Users are unable to link both Google and GitHub accounts to the Pieces Desktop app concurrently. Attempting to link both results in one account being unlinked. This issue has persisted for several years across multiple app versions and OS updates. A new account linking flow is under development to address this. As a temporary solution, users can schedule a meeting with the Pieces team for assistance.

related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have been experiencing an issue with the Pieces Desktop app where I am unable to link both my Google and GitHub accounts simultaneously. Despite following the documentation and contacting support multiple times, over several years, the issue persists?

Steps to Reproduce:

Log in to the Pieces Desktop app using my Google account.
Go to Settings > Account & Cloud Integrations.
Click on the GitHub integration and authenticate via GitHub.
After authentication, I am redirected back to the app, and only the GitHub account is linked.
Attempt to add the Google account again, authenticate, and return to the app.
Only the Google account is now linked, and the GitHub account is unlinked.
Expected Behavior: Both Google and GitHub accounts should be linked simultaneously.

Actual Behavior: Only one account (either Google or GitHub) is linked at a time. The other account gets unlinked when attempting to add both.

Additional Information:

I have been using the same email address for both Google and GitHub accounts since day one.
I have contacted support in the past, and they have reset data on their end, but the issue persists.
Disabling the GitHub email privacy option did not resolve the issue.
Environment:

Additional Context: I would prefer to resolve this issue over GitHub or Discord rather than booking a call, as past contact attempts via calls have not resolved the issue.  Also its not a critical requirement for me to use the app but it would be nice to one day be able to actually use this very old feature.
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key Points Raised:**

* The current account linking flow is not user-friendly and needs to be replaced.
* John Kenny raised an issue regarding this problem.
* Pieces team is aware of the issue and is actively working on a replacement.

**Problems Identified:**

* The existing account linking flow is not straightforward.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* A new account linking flow is being developed and will be implemented in mid to late February.
* In the meantime, the user can schedule a meeting with Mark (mark@pieces.app) to resolve the issue.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The new account linking flow is under development.
* The user can schedule a meeting with Mark to resolve the issue in the meantime.

**Additional Information:**

* The user can refer to the existing issues and documentation for more information.
* The user can also subscribe to the Pieces YouTube channel for updates.

recommendations: **Prioritize resolving the account linking issue:** This issue is a recurring problem affecting user experience. Allocate resources to expedite the development of the new account linking flow.

**Improve communication around known issues:** Provide users with clear and accessible information about the account linking problem, including workarounds like scheduling a meeting with the Pieces team.
**Consider a bug bounty program:** Incentivize users to report bugs and issues, like the long-standing account linking problem, by offering rewards for identifying and helping to resolve them.
